name: GET_CopyDBClusterParameterGroup
description: Copies the specified cluster parameter group.

SourceDBClusterParameterGroupIdentifier.description:
The identifier or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the source cluster parameter group.

Constraints:

  • Must specify a valid cluster parameter group.

  • If the source cluster parameter group is in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the copy, specify a valid parameter group identifier; for example, my-db-cluster-param-group, or a valid ARN.

  • If the source parameter group is in a different Amazon Web Services Region than the copy, specify a valid cluster parameter group ARN; for example, arn:aws:rds:us-east-1:123456789012:sample-cluster:sample-parameter-group.

TargetDBClusterParameterGroupIdentifier.description:
The identifier for the copied cluster parameter group.

Constraints:

  • Cannot be null, empty, or blank.

  • Must contain from 1 to 255 letters, numbers, or hyphens.

  • The first character must be a letter.

  • Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

Example: my-cluster-param-group1

TargetDBClusterParameterGroupDescription.description: A description for the copied cluster parameter group.

Tags.description: The tags that are to be assigned to the parameter group.

allOf.description: The required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "rds:". The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

The optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "rds:". The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

Tag.description: Metadata assigned to an Amazon DocumentDB resource consisting of a key-value pair.

$ul: **DBClusterParameterGroup**: Detailed information about a cluster parameter group.
